title: NBA Player Enes Kanter On Being Banned From Returning Home To Turkey
text:
Boston Celtics forward Enes Kanter, a Turkish national, spoke with Brian Kilmeade about not being allowed to visit his home country because he has been publicly critical of Turkish Prime Minister Recep Tayyip Erdogan. Kanter explained how his father is currently on trial just for being his dad and how his family had to put out a statement saying they have disowned him for speaking out against the government. Kanter believes if America puts sanctions on Turkey it will help solve the corruption in the Turkish government. Kanter also discussed how he is becoming a U.S. citizen in 2021, running free basketball camps across the country throughout the summer, including one in support for the El Paso shooting victims at Hanks High School.

Plus, Enes discusses a possible future as a professional wrestler for the WWE.
